org.spongepowered.api.block

Interface BlockState

  • All Superinterfaces:
    CatalogType, DataSerializable, DirectionRelativePropertyHolder, ImmutableDataHolder<BlockState>, ImmutableValueStore<BlockState,ImmutableDataManipulator<?,?>>, PropertyHolder, ValueContainer<BlockState>

    public interface BlockState
extends ImmutableDataHolder<BlockState>, DirectionRelativePropertyHolder, CatalogType
    Represents a particular "state" that can exist at a Location with a particular BlockType and various ImmutableValues defining the information for the "block". Note that normally, there may exist only a single instance of a particular BlockState as they are immutable, a particular instance may be cached for various uses.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  BlockState.Builder
      An ImmutableDataBuilder for a BlockState.
      static class  BlockState.MatcherBuilder
      A builder for building BlockState.StateMatchers.
      static class  BlockState.StateMatcher
      A BlockState matcher that will match various block states according to a pre-built list of BlockTraits and their values, such that not all BlockTraits contained in a BlockState must be matched.

      • builder

        Creates a new BlockState.Builder for building BlockStates.
        Returns:
        The builder

      • matcher

        static BlockState.MatcherBuilder matcher(BlockType type)
        Constructs a new BlockState.MatcherBuilder to construct a BlockState.StateMatcher.
        Parameters:
        type - The block type
        Returns:
        The builder

      • getType

        BlockType getType()
        Gets the base type of block.

        The type does not include block data such as the contents of inventories.

        Returns:
        The type of block

      • withExtendedProperties

        BlockState withExtendedProperties(Location<World> location)
        Applies extended properties for the current @{link BlockType} if any to the current BlockState. This usually is gathered from surrounding BlockState's.

        Note: This should only be called for live BlockState's at a specific Location for accurate results.

        Examples of some extended properties are:

        • snow on podzul dirt block
        • occupied status for beds
        • fence connections
        Parameters:
        location - The location used to search for extended properties
        Returns:
        The blockstate with extended properties included if any

      • cycleValue

        BlockState cycleValue(Key<? extends BaseValue<? extends Cycleable<?>>> key)
        Gets the associated BlockState with the cycled BaseValue. Note that only Cycleable values can be cycled. To change a particular Key'ed Value, usage of the ImmutableValueStore.with(Key, Object) is recommended.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to cycle
        Returns:
        The blockstate instance with the cycled value

      • snapshotFor

        BlockSnapshot snapshotFor(Location<World> location)
        Creates a new BlockSnapshot with this current BlockState at the desired Location. If the Location has the same BlockState, and the BlockType can house a TileEntity, the data from the tile entity may be included in the returned BlockSnapshot.
        Parameters:
        location - The location for the snapshot
        Returns:
        The newly created snapshot

      • getTraitValue

        <T extends Comparable<T>> Optional<T> getTraitValue(BlockTrait<T> blockTrait)
        Gets the Comparable value for the specific BlockTrait such that if the BlockState does not support the BlockTrait, Optional.empty() is returned.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The generic type of block trait
        Parameters:
        blockTrait - The block trait instance
        Returns:
        The comparable value, if available and compatible

      • getTrait

        Optional<BlockTrait<?>> getTrait(String blockTrait)
        Attempts to retrieve the BlockTrait instance associated with this BlockStates BlockType by string id. If there is no BlockTrait available, Optional.empty() is returned.
        Parameters:
        blockTrait - The block trait id
        Returns:
        The block trait, if available

      • withTrait

        Optional<BlockState> withTrait(BlockTrait<?> trait,
                               Object value)
        Gets the BlockState with the appropriate value for the given BlockTrait. If the BlockTrait is not supported, Optional.empty() is returned. If the object is not either an instance contained in BlockTrait.getPossibleValues() or an instance Object.toString(), Optional.empty() may be returned.
        Parameters:
        trait - The trait
        value - The value
        Returns:
        The blockstate, if supported

      • getTraits

        Collection<BlockTrait<?>> getTraits()
        Gets an immutable Collection of all applicable BlockTraits for this BlockState.
        Returns:
        An immutable collection of all applicable block traits

      • getTraitValues

        Collection<?> getTraitValues()
        Gets an immutable Collection of all the values for all BlockTraits for this BlockState.
        Returns:
        An immutable collection of all the values for all applicable traits

      • getTraitMap

        Map<BlockTrait<?>,?> getTraitMap()
        Gets an immutable or unmodifiable Map of the known BlockTraits to their current values for this BlockState.
        Returns:
        The immutable map of block traits to their values representing this block state
